summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel. The motion seeks to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund. The prosecutor informs McCawley of their intent to file a motion to quash the subpoena and proposes a call to discuss scheduling.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Recipient of the email from the AUSA, likely representing victims' interests in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case; her defense counsel filed a motion to subpoena the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, informing of the defense motion and intent to file a motion to quash.

connections.description: Prosecutor is opposing a defense motion filed by Maxwell's counsel.
Prosecutor is communicating with McCawley, likely a victims' attorney, about case developments.

events.title: Defense Motion to Subpoena Victim Fund
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel files a motion seeking a subpoena for information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

events.title: Prosecutor's Email Regarding Motion to Quash
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Sigrid McCawley to inform her of the defense motion and the prosecution's intent to file a motion to quash the subpoena later that week.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion on November 14, 2021, seeking to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York intended to file a motion to quash that subpoena.
The email communication shows coordination between the prosecution and victims' attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding the defense's legal maneuvers.
The defense's motion targeted information about a specific, redacted individual or entity from the Victim Compensation Fund.
The correspondence occurred during Maxwell's trial, as the prosecutor mentions being in court for jury selection.
